channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Predoc raises $30 million to stop document chasing in healthcare
item.description: Predoc—which uses AI to automate medical records management—has raised $30 million in funding, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: What the CEOs of Walmart, Best Buy, Home Depot, and others are saying about the nervous consumer
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Suntory’s outspoken CEO resigns after police drug search
item.description: As the chair of Japan’s second-biggest business lobby, Takeshi Niinami has been an outspoken and influential voice in business circles.

item.title: CEOs really are putting a pause on hiring ‘first-timers,’ career coach to the Fortune 500 warns—here’s how Gen Z grads can still land work
item.description: Million of Gen Zers are currently unemployed. But landing an entry-level job is about the get even harder, with CEOs freezing “first-timer” hires, a c...

item.title: How this week's jobs data could affect the stock market's rally
Here’s what’s worth streaming in September on Netflix, Hulu, HBO Max & more
This OpenAI engineer left her dream job and San Francisco home to move to Stockholm—all because of Trump 2.0
item.description: Ex-OpenAI researcher Miki Habryn left her dream job and U.S. home under Trump, joining a wave of Americans moving abroad amid political fears.

item.title: Gold prices hit all-time high on rising uncertainty; U.S. stock futures flat
Why this strategist thinks the S&P 500 can hit 7,750 by end of next year
September is historically bad for stocks. Why this time could be different.
